tab1.text1:
Join the Discord server for important info, updates, tribe recruitment, ingame to Discord chat, events, and more - Discord.gg/fibercraft

Make sure to read all rules listed in the rule tabs. All supply drops have element in them.

The shop is located on the Discord server, join it to link your Discord account.

A tutorial on how to link your account and use the ingame shop is posted on the Discord server.

Max wild is 700, perfect tame is 1050. Tames bought from the shop are max level.

Maximum tribe size is 10. You can use the AA Turret Genie to fill turrets quickly. You can use the AA Medical Station to heal tames quickly.

Wipe schedule, supply drop loot tables, and player punishments are all posted on the Discord.

Do boss fights at your own risk, they are known to occasionally be buggy. Don't do bossfights near a regularly scheduled wild dino wipe. Lost items will not be restored, only take what you are willing to lose.

Transferring between servers can be buggy, transfer at your own risk and be cautious. Large stacks of items (over 100k) almost always cause issues. Some items like the Dino Painter and Net Projectile are not transferable. Items lost due to transferring will not be restored.

tab2.text1:
G1 • No hacking or using cheat software of any kind. Punishment is a permanent ban.

G2 • No exploiting bugs within the game. Punishment can vary from a warning to permanent ban depending on severity and damages caused.

G3 • Never intentionally go into the mesh. Punishment is a permanent ban.

G4 • Don't name yourself or use in chat any slurs or seriously offensive terms. Punishment is up to staff depending on severity.

G5 • No self promoting of any kind is allowed in chat. Punishment is either a temporary or permanent ban.

G6 • No selling things for actual money. Trading isn't allowed in any form. Giving out tames or items is not allowed.

G7 • No insiding your tribe. Insiding is when a player joins a tribe with intent to sabotage it. Examples of insiding include destroying tribe structures, assisting raiders, powering off generators, disabling turrets, popcorning loot, or killing tames. Only let people into your tribe that you trust, lost items or tames are not compensated by staff. Punishment for insiding is a permanent ban.

G8 • Don't impersonate staff members or administration. Punishment can range from a warning to permanent ban depending on severity.

G9 • Using alt accounts is forbidden and will result in your accounts being banned. Attempting to ban evade, even if you believe your initial ban was illegitimate, will result in a permanent ban.

G10 • No making network threats, doxing, or making IRL threats. It doesn't matter if you are serious or joking. Punishment can range from warning to permanent ban depending on severity.

G11 • Intentionally causing pointless lag or causing lag for extended periods of time may result in warnings, admin wipes, or permanent bans.

tab3.text1:
R1 • No teaming with another tribe to raid someone or defend from a raid. Your tribe cannot join in on someone else's raid unless you raid their FOB first. If you counter raid you need to make reasonable efforts to raid the initial raiders and successfully clear them out before raiding the original target. Punishment for blatant teaming is a removal of both FOBs and a warning issued to both tribes. Punishment for joining in on a raid as a third-party will result in the removal of the third-party raider's FOB and a warning.

R2 • When raiding, your tribe cannot have more than 5 soaker type tames soaking at once. Your tribe can have no more than 10 total tames of any type getting shot by turrets at once. Punishment for this rule can range from the involved tames being deleted and a warning issued, up to a permanent ban depending on severity and damages caused.

R3 • Your FOB cannot be left abandoned for longer than 8 hours. If you finish a raid or intend to quit raiding, you need to unpower (destroy all generators and power off all turrets) and/or remove your FOB. Punishment for either of these is a warning and admin removal of your FOB.

R4 • Don't destroy or move/upload/transfer your loot if you are being raided. Punishment for first offense is a 2 week ban. Second offense is a permanent ban.

R5 • Abusing bugs within the game to raid people unfairly is not allowed. Punishment can range from a warning to permanent ban depending on severity and damages.

R6 • Platform saddle tames cannot be fully covered for raiding, they must have at least one exposed side. Raft raiding is allowed. Punishment is a warning and deletion of the tame.

tab4.text1:
B1 • Your tribe can claim no more than 2 caves and/or ratholes across the entire cluster. Punishment for breaking this rule is a structure wipe.

B2 • No structure spam that is not near an active FOB or base. No excessive structure spam. Spam should be limited to 40 foundations from the your base, FOB, or nearest tower.

B3 • All base spots must be accessible through normal means. Spots that require bed/chair, teleporting, grapple glitching, meshing, tame glitching, or any sort of bug abuse are subject to admin removal without warning.

B4 • Don't build turrets at spawn areas unless they are attached to a base. Don't build turrets out in the open anywhere unless they are protecting a teleporter, part of an active FOB, or part of your base. Punishment is removal of turrets and potential for a warning depending on severity.

B5 • Don't build on or block off any of the obelisk terminals, with the exception of blue obelisk on The Island and red obelisk on Scorched Earth. This includes leaving tames on aggressive. The punishment for this is an admin structure wipe or tame deletion.

B6 • Platform saddle tames cannot be fully covered, they must have at least one exposed side. Punishment is a warning and deletion of the tame.

B7 • Don't intentionally place structures in the mesh. All meshed structures are subject to admin removal, unintentional or not. Intentionally building inside of the mesh will lead to a permanent ban. If you believe there are meshed structures preventing you from building, you can use the Structure Locator :structurelocator: (crafted in your inventory) to find where they are. You can make a mesh removal ticket if the normal methods of removal don't work. If you discover a base fully within the mesh, make a player/tribe report ticket.
